Rite of Binding

Mystic Rite (Level 2)

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 3 Gnosis
Requirement: A willing or subdued spirit, and a suitable vessel, target, or location
Limit: Total Talens a Garou can have = Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). Exceeding ends oldest binding.

Resolution: None — when the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Binding types: (1) Spirit to Object — spirit bound into non-magical object (Talen); no magical bonuses by default; object destroyed releases spirit. (2) Spirit to Creature — bound to willing creature; may advise/empower/observe; no combat abilities; spirit cannot act independently. (3) Spirit to Location — bound to site; cannot leave; may influence thematically; often precursor to Caern Rites.

Binding Terms: ST defines obligations, limitations, and conditions for binding to end (explicit and finite).

Limitations: Cannot bind major spirits, gods, or unique entities; cannot force spirit against its nature; no spellcasting or combat actions. Binding ends if vessel destroyed, term fulfilled, higher effect dissolves it, or Garou releases spirit.

description.value:
Rite of Binding
Mystic Rite • Level 2

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 3 Gnosis
Requirement: A willing or subdued spirit, and a suitable vessel, target, or location
Limit: Total number of Talens a Garou can have at a time is limited by their Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

Description

The Rite of Binding compels a spirit to inhabit a specific form, place, or agreement. Through invocation and enforced pact, the Garou bind the spirit's essence to a purpose, limiting its freedom in exchange for stability or service.

This Rite does not enslave lightly. It creates a lasting spiritual contract.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Choose one of the following binding types:

Spirit to Object

  • The spirit is bound into a non-magical object, transforming it into a Talen or spiritually active item
  • The object gains no magical bonuses by default
  • Additional effects require further Rites or agreements
  • If the object is destroyed, the spirit is released

Spirit to Creature

  • The spirit is bound to a willing creature
  • The spirit may advise, empower, or observe
  • The binding does not grant combat abilities
  • The spirit cannot take independent actions

Spirit to Location

  • The spirit is bound to a specific site
  • The spirit cannot leave the area
  • It may influence the site thematically or narratively
  • This is often used as a precursor to Caern-related Rites

Binding Terms

When the Rite is completed, the Storyteller defines:

  • The spirit's obligations
  • The spirit's limitations
  • The conditions under which the binding ends

These terms should be explicit and finite.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Cannot bind major spirits, gods, or unique entities
  • Cannot force a spirit to act against its nature
  • Does not grant spellcasting or combat actions
  • A single Garou may maintain a number of active bindings equal to their Wisdom modifier (minimum 1)
  • Attempting to exceed this limit causes the oldest binding to end immediately

Breaking the Binding

A binding ends if:

  • The vessel is destroyed
  • The agreed-upon term is fulfilled
  • A higher-level spiritual effect forcibly dissolves it
  • The Garou willingly releases the spirit
